acknowledgments.summary: Chizuru Toyama of TXOne IoT/ICS Security Research Labs, working with Trend Micro’s Zero Day Initiative, reported this vulnerability to CISA.

notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could allow an attacker to redirect the user to a malicious webpage or to download a malicious file.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: CISA recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of this vulnerability. Specifically, users should take the following measures to protect themselves from social engineering attacks:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
CISA reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage on cisa.gov. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage on cisa.gov in the Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

references.summary: ICS Advisory ICSA-22-109-02 - Web Scraped Version

branches.name: Automated Logic is a part of Carrier Global Corporation

cwe.name: URL Redirection to Untrusted Site ('Open Redirect')

notes.text: WebCtrl Version 6.1 “Help” index pages are vulnerable to open redirection. If a user visits a maliciously crafted URL, this vulnerability could allow an attacker to redirect a user to a malicious webpage or download a malicious file.CVE-2022-1019 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 5.2 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:A/AC:L/PR:N/UI:R/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:N).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Carrier recommends users contact an Automated Logic dealer for instructions to download the latest version of WebCTRL.
Carrier also recommends the following manual workaround:
Please see Carrier product security advisory CARR-PSA-001-1121 for more information.
